declarations.comments:
The `Cofree` `Comonad` for a functor.

A value of type `Cofree f a` consists of an `f`-branching
tree, annotated with labels of type `a`.

The `Comonad` instance supports _redecoration_, recomputing
labels from the local context.
declarations.title: Cofree

declarations.comments:
Create a value of type `Cofree f a` from a label and a
functor-full of "subtrees".
declarations.title: mkCofree

declarations.comments: Returns the label for a tree.
declarations.title: head

declarations.comments: Returns the "subtrees" of a tree.
declarations.title: tail

declarations.comments:
Explore a value in the cofree comonad by using an expression in a
corresponding free monad.

The free monad should be built from a functor which pairs with the
functor underlying the cofree comonad.
declarations.title: explore

declarations.comments:
The free monad for a type constructor `f`.

Implemented in the spirit of [Reflection without Remorse](http://okmij.org/ftp/Haskell/zseq.pdf),
the free monad is represented using a sequential data structure in
order to overcome the quadratic complexity of left-associated binds
and traversal through the free monad structure.
declarations.title: Free

declarations.comments:
Lift an impure value described by the generating type constructor `f` into
the free monad.
declarations.title: liftF

declarations.comments:
Lift an action described by the generating type constructor `f` into
`Free g` using `Inject` to go from `f` to `g`.
declarations.title: liftFI

declarations.comments: Suspend a value given the applicative functor `f` into the free monad.
declarations.title: suspendF

declarations.comments:
Use a natural transformation to change the generating type constructor of a
free monad.
declarations.title: hoistFree

declarations.comments:
Embed computations in one `Free` monad as computations in the `Free` monad
for a coproduct type constructor.

This construction allows us to write computations which are polymorphic in
the particular `Free` monad we use, allowing us to extend the functionality
of our monad later.
declarations.title: injF

declarations.comments:
Run a free monad with a natural transformation from the type constructor `f`
to the tail-recursive monad `m`. See the `MonadRec` type class for more
details.
declarations.title: foldFree

declarations.comments:
Like `foldFree`, but for folding into some other Free monad without the
overhead that `MonadRec` incurs.
declarations.title: substFree

declarations.comments:
Run a free monad with a function that unwraps a single layer of the functor
`f` at a time.
declarations.title: runFree

declarations.comments:
Run a free monad with a function mapping a functor `f` to a tail-recursive
monad `m`. See the `MonadRec` type class for more details.
declarations.title: runFreeM

declarations.comments: Unwraps a single layer of the functor `f`.
declarations.title: resume

modules.name: Control.Monad.Trampoline
modules.comments:
A _trampoline_ monad, which can be used at the bottom of
a monad transformer stack to avoid stack overflows in large
monadic computations.

declarations.comments:
The `Trampoline` monad

A computation of type `Trampoline a` consists of zero or more lazy
suspensions before a value is returned.
declarations.title: Trampoline

declarations.comments: Return a value immediately
declarations.title: done

declarations.comments: Suspend a computation by one step.
declarations.title: suspend

declarations.comments: Use the `Trampoline` monad to represent a `Lazy` value.
declarations.title: delay'

declarations.comments: Use the `Trampoline` monad to represent the delayed evaluation of a value.
declarations.title: delay

declarations.comments: Run a computation in the `Trampoline` monad.
declarations.title: runTrampoline

declarations.comments:
`Coyoneda` is encoded as an existential type using `Data.Exists`.

This type constructor encodes the contents of the existential package.
declarations.title: CoyonedaF

declarations.comments:
The `Coyoneda` `Functor`.

`Coyoneda f` is a `Functor` for any type constructor `f`. In fact,
it is the _free_ `Functor` for `f`.
declarations.title: Coyoneda

declarations.comments:
Construct a value of type `Coyoneda f b` from a mapping function and a
value of type `f a`.
declarations.title: coyoneda

declarations.comments:
Deconstruct a value of `Coyoneda a` to retrieve the mapping function and
original value.
declarations.title: unCoyoneda

declarations.comments: Lift a value described by the type constructor `f` to `Coyoneda f`.
declarations.title: liftCoyoneda

declarations.comments: Lower a value of type `Coyoneda f a` to the `Functor` `f`.
declarations.title: lowerCoyoneda

declarations.comments:
Use a natural transformation to change the generating type constructor of a
`Coyoneda`.
declarations.title: hoistCoyoneda

declarations.comments:
The Yoneda `Functor`

`Yoneda f` is a `Functor` for any type constructor `f`.
declarations.title: Yoneda

declarations.comments: Run a computation of type `Yoneda f a`.
declarations.title: runYoneda

declarations.comments: Lift a value described by the `Functor` `f` to the `Functor` `Yoneda f`.
declarations.title: liftYoneda

declarations.comments: Lower a value of type `Yoneda f a` to the type constructor `f`.
declarations.title: lowerYoneda

declarations.comments:
Use a natural transformation to change the generating type constructor of a
`Yoneda`.
declarations.title: hoistYoneda
